page.title: 02LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: Local powers are split between Wilts County and Kennet District Councils. The Parish Council with 15 elected members precepts on the rates for minor local services. Although active committees look after planning, footpaths, lighting and playing field matters, agitation has to substitute for power. Party politics predominate in elections to higher authorities. The Parish looks particularly to its Liberal County Councillor for support and advice. The present MP is a Tory, but there is a long tradition of Liberal interest. Although crime is rare a village constable could play a valuable part in moderating the behaviour of some youngsters, bored by lack of jobs and facilities. Litter, vandalism and noise are expensive and tiresome consequences. In emergency police are called from Marlborough
